channel.title: How to fix my port
channel.description: ugh, ive been have this problem for a long time. i believe it is the last step to make my private server online when i press runserver.bat to run it all it tells me is unable to startup listner 43594 port already in use?

item.title: How to fix my port
item.dc:creator: @Runefell Runefell
item.description:
@Runefell wrote:

Just told you how to do it, and yes I meant runserver.bat

Read full topic

item.title: How to fix my port
item.dc:creator: @911_u_died 911 u died
item.description:
@911_u_died wrote:

what do you mean by close/open my server you mean the runserver.bat thign
and i just checked my port thing it says my isp has blocked port 43594 and did not block 5555 any way i can unblock 43594

Read full topic

item.title: How to fix my port
item.dc:creator: @Runefell Runefell
item.description:
@Runefell wrote:

Thats cause you didn’t do it right. Just leave your Server.java how it is at port 43594, don’t even touch that. Close your Server. Go into bittorrent and change the torrent port to 5555. Turn your server back on and change the bittorrent port back to 43594.

Read full topic

item.title: How to fix my port
item.dc:creator: @911_u_died 911 u died
item.description:
@911_u_died wrote:

k i went and dled bittorrent and installed it i change dthe server.java port to 43594 and i set the bittorrent port to 43594 then i closed out the internet pages i had up and i left open the source folder and bittorrent i pressed runserver.bat and it still said 43594 in use

Read full topic

item.title: How to fix my port
item.dc:creator: @Pluvia Pluvia
item.description:
@Pluvia wrote:

[quote=“Runefell, post:7, topic:363748”]Any program on your computer could be using these ports. For example if you have any Torrent programs running, or other programs that require connection to the internet you will need to exit out of them, also try using the task manager to look for them. Once you find what program is using port 43594, you can exit out of it and change your server port back to 43594 and run it.
I also have another solution if that doesn’t work.
If you don’t have Bittorrent installed in the first place, install it now. Change your Bittorrent port to 5555, run your server, and then change the Bittorrent port back to 43594.

I hope that helps.[/quote]
Do what this guy says

Read full topic

item.title: How to fix my port
item.dc:creator: @Runefell Runefell
item.description:
@Runefell wrote:

Any program on your computer could be using these ports. For example if you have any Torrent programs running, or other programs that require connection to the internet you will need to exit out of them, also try using the task manager to look for them. Once you find what program is using port 43594, you can exit out of it and change your server port back to 43594 and run it.
I also have another solution if that doesn’t work.
If you don’t have Bittorrent installed in the first place, install it now. Change your Bittorrent port to 5555, run your server, and then change the Bittorrent port back to 43594.

I hope that helps.

Read full topic
